Executive Summary

Dean Foods Corporation is a leading manufacturer and distributor of fresh milk and related dairy products, shelf-stable and refrigerated food and beverage products, frozen food products, coffee and plastic containers.  The company's products are distributed throughout the United States and Puerto Rico.

Morningstar Foods, LLC Mount Crawford is a division of Dean Foods.  It is our corporate and company policy is to provide every employee a safe and healthy workplace.  Our manufacturing process uses Anhydrous Ammonia for refrigeration.  Our corporate safety department provides guidance for implimentation, operation and review of the standards that govern the Ammonia Refrigeration systems.  

The Mount Crawford facility is located in the Shenandoah Valley region of Virginia.  The facility employs approximately 280 full-time employees.  Our primary products include extended shelf-life (ESL) and aseptic dairy and non-dairy food products.  The refrigeration system is used for procerssing and cold storage of dairy food products.

Five Year Accident History

Morningstar Foods hjas maintained excellent ammonia release prevention programs.  The Mount Crawford plant has not had a release of Anhydrous Ammonia within the last five years.

Emergency Response Program

Our emergency response program (Emergency Action Plan) consists of hazard evaluation, mitigation and control, and recovery (business continuity planning).  Safety, Operations, Administration, Engineering, and Maintenance are involved in the evaluation and emergency management response planning and execution.  All employees are trained in basic emergency actions (primarily evacuation).  Specialized employees receive specialized training.  We have a group of employees trained and certified as 24 hr Hazwoper technicians.  Our emergency efforts are coordinated with the Bridgewater Fire Department.  All employees are trained in emergency action procedures, hazard communication and chemical safety.  Our

emergency response plans have been evaluated by OSHA and no deficiencies were noted.  No citations were issued.  The general procedures are as follows:

1.  Identify the emergency situatiuon.
2.  Alert the Emergency Action Team via radio or alarm system.
3.  Evaluate the nature and extent of the problem, then notify local authorities if necessary.
4.  Initiate a local or general evacuation.
5.  Coordinate mitigation activities with the local emergency response authorities.

Continuous Improvement

The process safety management policy of Morningstar Foods is as follows:  Identify hazardous processes, evaluate and continuously improve on risk management practicies that reduce the liklihood of a release event or emergency situation at each facility.  We will communicate effectively to management, affected employees and the community the necessary awareness and preparation for the response to any potential or actual events, based on the probability of risk.  We integrate prevention through hazard assessment, practice and policy in order to reduce the liklihood of a release event.  This process includes ongoing training and management of the refrigeration systems.  We maintain compliance with PSM and RMP requirements.

Our company has an extensive audit and critical self-analysis program, which is under the direction and control of the corporate safety department.  Each facility is audited annually.  The audit is performed by the corporate director of safety.  Audit scores are one of the critical plant performance metrics.  Facility management is accountable for the facility performance rating.  PSM, Hazard Communication, Control of Hazardous Energy, Contractor Control, Emergency Action Plan, Evacuation, and many other programs are included in the annual safety audit.  In the event that any deficiencies are found, each audit includes specific follow-up and written corrective measures.  We believe our programs are highly effective as evidenced by our accident history.
